steps.name: Plan Your Location
steps.description: Before you officially form & register your business, its important to have a target location and lease in mind - that way you can form & register your business using your proposed business address. If you change the location of your restaurant after you form & register, you will need to file an ammendement to your Business Formation & Registration,

tasks.name: Zoning Requirements
tasks.description: Verify that your desired building is zoned for office use.

steps.name: Research and Prepare Your Business License

tasks.name: Register with the N.J. Division of Consumer Affairs
tasks.description: All home improvement contractors, whether operating as an individual or as a corporate entity must register with the Division of Consumer Affairs. By registering you are also committing to follow regulations and guidelines set out in the Contractor's Registration Act. Please review all guidelines and the application in the attached document.
to_complete_must_have: complete the disclosure statement page of the application
a policy of commercial general liability insurance in a minimum amount of $500,000 per occurrence

steps.name: Sign Your Lease & File Local Permits
steps.description: You can now sign your lease and file local permits under the protection of your new legal entity and business name.

tasks.name: Municipality Licenses
tasks.description: Check with your municipality to see if there are any other licenses you should be aware of.
